title: High Priority for User Management Processes - Need of the Hour for Financial Services Market in Identity and Access Management
text:
The report titled Identity and Access Management (IAM) Market - Banking and Financial Services Outlook (2014-18) showcases an in-depth analysis of banking and financial services vertical in terms of market size and its respective market forces. This report also forecasts the growth numbers till 2018 (on a YoY basis) and hence suggests the Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) for the estimated period.
The report brings about a detailed description of the global industry landscape, the global market forces (drivers, constraints, opportunities and challenges), metrics and market share for the IAM market.
IAM Provides Respite From Major Operational Risks involved in Financial Services Industry
IAM has provisioned better user management processes especially critical in the banking world, where, if access to IT is not managed in a rational way, it can be a source of major operational risks, which can directly translate into financial losses. Hence to avoid this, banks adopt IAM solutions that can offer significant advantages like for example, immediate reduction in operational risks by reducing the possibility of data access loopholes, avoid unauthorized or illicit accesses and allocation of access rights. It also facilitates users to measure the operational risks and can thus be directly used by the reporting tools already in place. Adoption of IAM solution in the banking sector is being seen as a necessity these days. If not managed properly, identity thefts can lead to major operational risks with camouflaged access into the banking information.
